verses.text: 耶穌基督的家譜（路3:23~38。參得4:18~22；代上3:10~17）大衛的子孫，亞伯拉罕的後裔，耶穌基督的家譜：

words.note: Lit. 'family register'
Abbreviation for 路加福音 (Lùjiā Fúyīn)

words.pinyin: sān èr shí sān zhì sān shí bā
words.note: Biblical chapter and verse reference. '~' denotes 'to' or 'through'.
Abbreviation for 路得記 (Lùdé Jì)

words.pinyin: sì yī bā zhì èr shí èr

words.note: Abbreviation for 歷代志上 (Lìdài Zhì Shàng)

words.pinyin: sān yī líng zhì yī qī

words.note: Implies a lineage, 'sons and grandsons'.

verses.text: 亞伯拉罕生以撒，以撒生雅各，雅各生猶大和他的兄弟，
他瑪給猶大生了法勒斯和謝拉，法勒斯生希斯崙，希斯崙生亞蘭，

words.note: Indicates the beneficiary or agent in this context.
The 'le' indicates completion.

verses.text: 亞蘭生亞米拿達，亞米拿達生拿順，拿順生撒門，
喇合給撒門生了波阿斯，路得給波阿斯生了俄備得，俄備得生耶西，

words.note: Indicates the beneficiary or agent in this context.
Indicates the beneficiary or agent in this context.

verses.text: 耶西生大衛王。烏利亞的妻子給大衛生了所羅門，
所羅門生羅波安，羅波安生亞比雅，亞比雅生亞撒，
亞撒生約沙法，約沙法生約蘭，約蘭生烏西雅，
烏西雅生約坦，約坦生亞哈斯，亞哈斯生希西家，
希西家生瑪拿西，瑪拿西生亞們，亞們生約西亞，
猶太人被擄到巴比倫的時候，約西亞生耶哥尼雅和他的兄弟。

words.note: Refers to the people of Judah or Jewish people.
Refers to the Babylonian exile.
In genealogies, '生' means 'begat' or 'fathered'.

verses.text: 被擄到巴比倫以後，耶哥尼雅生撒拉鐵，撒拉鐵生所羅巴伯，

words.note: Here functions as a noun phrase referring to the event of being exiled.

verses.text: 所羅巴伯生亞比玉，亞比玉生以利亞敬，以利亞敬生亞所，
亞所生撒督，撒督生亞金，亞金生以律，
以律生以利亞撒，以利亞撒生馬但，馬但生雅各，
雅各生約瑟，就是馬利亞的丈夫；那稱為基督的耶穌，是馬利亞所生的。

words.note: A title meaning 'anointed one'.

verses.text: 這樣，從亞伯拉罕到大衛，一共是十四代；從大衛到被擄到巴比倫的時候，也是十四代；從被擄到巴比倫的時候到基督，又是十四代。

words.note: A title meaning 'anointed one'.

verses.text: 耶穌基督的降生（路2:1~7）耶穌基督的降生是這樣的：耶穌的母親馬利亞許配了約瑟，他們還沒有成親，馬利亞就從聖靈懷了孕。

words.note: Refers specifically to the birth of a noble or divine being.
Refers to the Gospel of Luke.
Refers specifically to the birth of a noble or divine being.

verses.text: 她丈夫約瑟是個義人，不願張揚使她受辱，就打算暗中與她解除婚約。
他一直想著這些事，主的使者就在夢中向他顯現，說：「大衛的子孫約瑟，只管放膽把你的妻子馬利亞迎娶過來，因為她懷的孕是從聖靈來的。

words.note: Refers to God or Christ.
Often refers to an angel in biblical context.

verses.text: 她必生一個兒子，你要給他起名叫耶穌，因為他要把自己的子民從罪惡中拯救出來。」

words.note: Refers to a nation or people as children of a ruler/God.
Common in religious texts for 'sin'.
Often suffixed to nouns to indicate 'in' or 'among'.
Verb complement indicating outward direction or completion.

verses.text: 這整件事的發生，是要應驗主藉著先知所說的：

words.note: Commonly used in the Bible for prophecies being fulfilled.
Refers to God or Jesus in biblical context.
Lit. 'one who knows first'.
Forms a nominal phrase from a verb, e.g., 'what was said'.

verses.text: 「必有童女懷孕生子，他的名要叫以馬內利。」以馬內利就是「　神與我們同在」的意思。

words.note: Commonly used in biblical translations for 'virgin'.
A classical/biblical verb-object compound.
The preceding space often indicates reverence for God's name.
Common phrase in religious contexts meaning 'be with'.

verses.text: 約瑟睡醒了，就照著主的使者所吩咐的，把妻子迎娶過來；

words.note: Refers to God or Jesus in biblical context.
Often refers to angels in biblical context.
More formal or traditional than '結婚'.
Verb complement indicating direction towards the speaker or completion of action.

verses.text: 只是在孩子出生以前，並沒有與她同房。約瑟給孩子起名叫耶穌。

words.note: Often used to emphasize a negative statement.
Euphemism for sexual intimacy, common in older texts.
